answers.answer: High blood sugar (which can be caused by interferon)  can cause the hunger you describe.  Let your doctor know and ask him to check your blood sugar (fasting).Co

I have type 1 diabetes and high blood sugar causes you not to want to eat.  Low blood sugar (and resulting 'too much insulin') makes you hungry all the time.But I second CoWriter's suggestion of having your blood sugar checked.  Perhaps even a 'sugar challenge'' test.  They give you a drink that is loaded with sugar, make you wait, then check your blood sugar.With type 1 diabetes being an 'autoimmune disease', I have little doubt that mine was caused by hep c.  :(

Diabetes never even crossed my mind with everything else going on in life.  I feel stupid now.I have had the fasting glucose tests and the "sugar challenge" test, I think that my doc called it a glucose tolerance test (tastes like flat orange pop and is in a glass bottle, with aluminum cap).Usually my blood sugar runs low, except during pregnancy, it ran high with both my girls.  I actually developed gestational diabetes with my 5 month old.  I was able to control it with diet and with no insuline, but was back to normal, well normal for me, within a couple of weeks of delivery.Thank you both so much.  I'm going to go get out my tester and see what my reading is (as I kick myself in the rear on the way to the medicine cabinet for not thinking of that)

Hi there.  This might have some bearing on the headaches/migraines too?  Gotta ask - Are you drinking enough water during treatment??  I understand that's quite important and helps with certain sides.  If you have suffered with migraines for awhile though, have a harder look at your routines to determine if you need to take something out of your diet (salt, caffeine, MSG, chocolate) if you have food/beverage allergies.  I also found that chiropractic adjustments helped unpinch things that were causing my headaches.  Best to you =)
Yes, glucose tolerance test.  :)I'm hoping your reading was okay!

My reading last night was 192, but it was about 30 min. after having half a peanut butter sandwich with my riba.  My reading now, being 2 hours after an average size bowl of potato soup is 113, so not bad.  I am still going to keep a closer check on it, just in case.beeblessed-- family docs say no to me going to chiropractor until i see the neurosurgeon for my buldging disks and I have a tear in the tissues surrounding my spinal cord in the middle of 2 of the buldged disks.  Hopefully soon I am able to go back to get adjusted,  keeping my spine somewhat in line does seem to make the headaches less frequent.

Hmmm...  I'm in Canada and we use mmol/L.  Depending on who you ask, acceptable is 6.0.So 6.0 x 18.0182 = 108 (ish)192 x .0555 = 10.7 (ish)192 sounds pretty high.(I only know these calculations because my husband is American and we lived in the U.S. for a time).  ;)Please do keep an eye on it.  Diabetes is almost as slow a killer as hep c, when uncontrolled.

I was concerned about losing weight during trt, but nausea hasn't been an issue after the first few weeks.  My appetite has increased during trt and I find it helps to eat small, but frequent meals.  I'm very lucky that I've never been overweight and I'm more concerned about losing 5 pounds and looking gaunt.  That hasn't happend.  Ok, time for me to go find some chocolate pudding or something tastey.   Chow.
Doc says around 100 is normal, but that is fasting.  Given the amount of PB I had on my sandwich, I think the 192 was ok only 30 minutes after eating.
Peanut butter is fairly low in carbs and given the protein content, it is a slower carb.  Even 4 tablespoons of peanut butter would only be 16 grams.

I don't know how you guys are doing it so easily, I have never been a big eater in the mornings and this getting up at 5:30 and eating right away is hard for me, it's like I have to ckoke it down, gaging the whole way.
I too suffer from migraine and the tx has lowered my threshold slot. My dr says   They see this a lot on tx

The morning one is a killer. But at night, I'm cooking more and found that less dairy helps me a lot w/ nausea. I even ate quinoa n avocado w bacon for breakfast. I'm hungry all the time right now too. Your body needs nurtrition! Karen :)

question: is there anyone who is on the pegasys/riba combo who has been staying hungry all the time?  I started tx on the 19th and since saturday, all i want to do is eat.  i have never been a big eater (eat maybe a toddler sized portion of low-fat, low-carb meal 1 time a day if even that)  sometimes just snacking a little through the day.  but now i am staying soooooooo hungry.  this is of great concern to me because i had been trying to lose weight prior to tx.  (down 74 lbs. since mid-march)also, anyone have any suggestions for the headaches?  i have always gotten severe/ migrain level headaches for years, but this one seems to be a little different, none of my non-med tricks have seemed to phase it.other than the staying hungry, headache, and achy-ness, not having any major sides though, so hopefully this is good news.
title: pegasys/co-pegasys--staying hungry
